company.name: Unrollme Inc.
company.business_description: Unrollme provides two services to consumers to help them manage subscription emails: unsubscribing from unwanted subscription emails and consolidating wanted subscription emails into one daily email called the 'Rollup' to minimize inbox clutter. The company offered its services through its website since at least June 2012, and through iOS and Android apps since November 2015 and October 2017, respectively.

case_info.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act

complaint.factual_background: Unrollme Inc. provided email management services requiring full access to users' email accounts. While claiming it would only scan for subscription emails and would not touch personal emails, Unrollme granted its parent company Slice access to users' inboxes to collect entire e-receipts containing personal information including names, addresses, credit card data, and purchase history, which Slice then sold to third parties for market research purposes. Prior to May 2017, Unrollme did not disclose this data collection practice anywhere on its homepage, FAQ, or signup screens.

representations_made.description: Claimed it would not touch users' personal emails
representations_made.quoted_text: Don't worry, we won't touch your personal stuff.

representations_made.description: Claimed it would never touch users' personal emails and only watch for newsletters
representations_made.quoted_text: Don't worry, this is just to watch for those pesky newsletters, we'll never touch your personal stuff.

representations_made.description: Claimed access was required only to scan for subscriptions and clear out inbox
representations_made.quoted_text: Unroll.Me requires access to your inbox so we can scan for subscriptions and allow you to begin clearing out your inbox.

representations_made.description: Told customers it only looks at subscription emails, not personal emails or those sent to/by individuals
representations_made.quoted_text: we are not reading your personal emails or those that are sent to/by individuals. Our service only looks at the subscription emails that are associated with your account….

representations_made.description: Told customers the algorithm only looks for subscription emails and does not touch private emails
representations_made.quoted_text: our algorithm only looks for subscription emails and does not touch your private emails….

representations_made.description: Told customers it accesses inbox to scan for subscription emails only
representations_made.quoted_text: Our algorithm accesses your inbox to scan for subscription emails only….

representations_made.description: Told customers it cannot see emails that don't fit the algorithm's criteria for subscription-based emails only
representations_made.quoted_text: Unroll.Me is not able to see emails that do not fit our algorithm's criteria, which scans for a subscription-based emails only.

representations_made.description: Told customers it cannot see the content of emails and only filters subscription-based emails
representations_made.quoted_text: We are not able to see the content of your emails and the only emails we filter are subscription-based emails….

counts.title: False Representation About Accessing Personal Emails
counts.representation: Unrollme would not touch users' personal emails
counts.fact: Unrollme grants access to its users' inboxes, including personal emails in the form of e-receipts, which is then used to collect and sell purchase information contained therein to third parties
counts.conclusion: Therefore, the representation set forth in Paragraph 16 is false or misleading.

counts.title: Deceptive Omission About Data Collection Practices
counts.representation: Unrollme required access to users' inboxes in order to scan for subscription emails
counts.fact: Unrollme failed to disclose, or failed to disclose adequately, that Unrollme also grants access to its users' inboxes, including personal emails in the form of e-receipts, which is then used to collect and sell purchase information contained therein to third parties. This fact would be material to consumers in their decision to use Unrollme's services.
counts.conclusion: Unrollme's failure to disclose or disclose adequately the material information described in Paragraph 20, in light of the representation set forth in Paragraph 19, is a deceptive act or practice.

definitions.Consumer Email: any message to or from a consumer that is sent electronically via a network to a unique email address, and includes any subpart thereof and the content of the communication.
definitions.Covered Consumer: all consumers known to Respondent, as of the effective date of this Order, who enrolled in a Covered Product after initially declining to grant Respondent access to their email accounts.
definitions.Covered Product: any product, service or software operated, owned or distributed by Respondent that requires access to Consumer Emails.
definitions.Covered Information: personally identifiable information from or about an individual consumer, including: (a) a first and last name; (b) a physical address or precise geolocation; (c) an email address or other online contact information, such as an instant messaging user identifier or an individual's screen name; (d) a telephone number; (e) a Social Security number; (f) a driver's license or other government-issued identification number; (g) a financial institution account number; (h) credit or debit card number; or (i) a persistent identifier, such as a unique customer number held in a "cookie," a static Internet Protocol ("IP") address, a mobile device ID, or processor serial number.
definitions.Inactive User: a Covered Consumer who cannot access a Covered Product without first re-enrolling in the Covered Product and whose email accounts are not accessible to Respondent.
definitions.Respondent: Unrollme Inc., and its successors and assigns.

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Misrepresentations About Covered Information and Consumer Emails
provisions.summary: Respondent must not misrepresent the extent to which it accesses, collects, uses, stores, or shares Covered Information or Consumer Emails in connection with any Covered Product.

requirements.description: Must not misrepresent extent of accessing, collecting, using, storing, or sharing Covered Information or Consumer Emails
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS ORDERED that Respondent, and Respondent's officers, agents, employees, and attorneys, and all other persons in active concert or participation with any of them, who receive actual notice of this Order, whether acting directly or indirectly, in connection with any Covered Product must not misrepresent in any manner, expressly or by implication, the extent to which it accesses, collects, uses, stores, or shares Covered Information or Consumer Emails.

provisions.title: Required Notification About Respondent's Consumer Email Access
provisions.summary: Respondent must directly notify all Covered Consumers (who are not Inactive Users) that Respondent or its parent accesses or collects email purchase receipts for use in market research products sold to third parties.

requirements.description: Send email notification to Covered Consumers about email purchase receipt collection for market research
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Respondent must directly notify all Covered Consumers, who are not Inactive Users, and from whom Respondent or its parent access or collect email purchase receipts for use in market research products of the fact that Respondent or its parent access or collect email purchase receipts for use in market research products that are sold to third parties. Notification must be made by an email, consisting solely of the information contained in Exhibit A, sent within ten (10) days of the entry of this Order, with the subject line "Update: How We Use and Share Your Information" and without any other materials accompanying the email.

provisions.title: Required Deletion of Data
provisions.summary: Respondent must delete all stored email purchase receipts and related Covered Information collected from Covered Consumers who enrolled before June 1, 2017, unless consumers provide affirmative express consent.

requirements.description: Delete stored email purchase receipts and Covered Information from Covered Consumers who enrolled before June 1, 2017 (unless affirmative consent obtained)
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Respondent, and its officers, agents, and employees who receive actual notice of this Order must, within ten (10) days from the date of entry of this Order, delete from Respondent and Respondent's parent's commercial production systems all stored email purchase receipts, and Covered Information or other content obtained from these receipts, that was collected from Covered Consumers who enrolled in a Covered Product prior to June 1, 2017, unless such consumer provides affirmative, express consent to such storage.

provisions.title: Acknowledgments of the Order
provisions.summary: Respondent must obtain acknowledgments of receipt of this Order from the Commission, personnel, and business entities, and deliver copies to specified individuals.

requirements.description: Submit acknowledgment of receipt of Order to Commission
requirements.quoted_text: Respondent, within 10 days after the effective date of this Order, must submit to the Commission an acknowledgment of receipt of this Order sworn under penalty of perjury.

requirements.description: Deliver copy of Order to principals, officers, directors, LLC managers/members, employees with managerial responsibilities, agents, and representatives for 10 years
requirements.quoted_text: For 10 years after the issuance date of this Order, Respondent must deliver a copy of this Order to: (1) all principals, officers, directors, and LLC managers and members; (2) all employees having managerial responsibilities for conduct related to the subject matter of the Order, and all agents and representatives who participate in conduct related to the subject matter of the Order; and (3) any business entity resulting from any change in structure as set forth in the Provision titled Compliance Report and Notices. Delivery must occur within 10 days after the effective date of this Order for current personnel. For all others, delivery must occur before they assume their responsibilities.

requirements.description: Obtain signed and dated acknowledgment from individuals and entities who received copy of Order
requirements.quoted_text: From each individual or entity to which Respondent delivered a copy of this Order, Respondent must obtain, within 30 days, a signed and dated acknowledgment of receipt of this Order.

provisions.title: Compliance Report and Notices
provisions.summary: Respondent must submit compliance reports and notices to the Commission, including an annual compliance report and notices of changes to contact information or structure.

requirements.description: Submit annual compliance report one year after issuance
requirements.quoted_text: One year after the issuance date of this Order, Respondent must submit a compliance report, sworn under penalty of perjury, in which Respondent must: (1) identify the primary physical, postal, and email address and telephone number, as designated points of contact, which representatives of the Commission, may use to communicate with Respondent; (2) identify all of Respondent's businesses by all of their names, telephone numbers, and physical, postal, email, and Internet addresses; (3) describe the activities of each business, including the goods and services offered; (4) describe in detail whether and how Respondent is in compliance with each Provision of this Order; and (5) provide a copy of each Acknowledgment of the Order obtained pursuant to this Order, unless previously submitted to the Commission.

requirements.description: Submit compliance notice within 14 days of changes to designated contact or structure
requirements.quoted_text: Respondent must submit a compliance notice, sworn under penalty of perjury, within 14 days of any change in the following: (1) any designated point of contact; or (2) the structure of Respondent or any entity that Respondent has any ownership interest in or controls directly or indirectly that may affect compliance obligations arising under this Order, including: creation, merger, sale, or dissolution of the entity or any subsidiary, parent, or affiliate that engages in any acts or practices subject to this Order.

requirements.description: Submit notice of bankruptcy or insolvency proceeding filing
requirements.quoted_text: Respondent must submit notice of the filing of any bankruptcy petition, insolvency proceeding, or similar proceeding by or against Respondent within 14 days of its filing.

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Respondent must create and retain specified records for 10 years after Order issuance (created) and 5 years (retained), including accounting records, personnel records, consumer complaints, screenshots, and compliance records.

requirements.description: Create and retain accounting records showing revenues, costs, and net profit or loss
requirements.quoted_text: accounting records showing the revenues from all goods or services sold, the costs incurred in generating those revenues, and resulting net profit or loss;

requirements.description: Create and retain personnel records for each person providing services related to the Order
requirements.quoted_text: personnel records showing, for each person providing services in relation to any aspect of the Order, whether as an employee or otherwise, that person's: name; addresses; telephone numbers; job title or position; dates of service; and (if applicable) the reason for termination;

requirements.description: Create and retain copies or records of all consumer complaints and responses
requirements.quoted_text: copies or records of all consumer complaints, whether received directly or indirectly, such as through a third party, and any response;

requirements.description: Create and retain screenshots/screencasts of enrollment process and representations subject to Order
requirements.quoted_text: A copy of each unique screenshot, screencast or equivalent record of the (1) online and mobile user interface for the enrollment process of a Covered Product; and of (2) each part of Respondent's website that makes a representation subject to this Order, including screenshots, screencasts or equivalent records that show how the user navigated to access the statement or representation (e.g., a screenshot showing the link to the statement, and a screenshot of the statement itself);

requirements.description: Create and retain all records necessary to demonstrate full compliance with each provision of Order
requirements.quoted_text: all records necessary to demonstrate full compliance with each provision of this Order, including all submissions to the Commission.

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The Commission may monitor Respondent's compliance by requesting additional reports or records, interviewing personnel, and using other lawful investigative means including posing as consumers.

requirements.description: Submit additional compliance reports or records upon Commission request
requirements.quoted_text: Within 10 days of receipt of a written request from a representative of the Commission, Respondent must: submit additional compliance reports or other requested information, which must be sworn under penalty of perjury, and produce records for inspection and copying.

requirements.description: Permit Commission representatives to communicate directly with Respondent and interview affiliated individuals
requirements.quoted_text: For matters concerning this Order, representatives of the Commission are authorized to communicate directly with Respondent. Respondent must permit representatives of the Commission to interview anyone affiliated with Respondent who has agreed to such an interview. The interviewee may have counsel present.

requirements.description: Allow Commission to use lawful investigative means including posing as consumers or other entities
requirements.quoted_text: The Commission may use all other lawful means, including posing through its representatives as consumers, suppliers, or other individuals or entities, to Respondent or any individual or entity affiliated with Respondent, without the necessity of identification or prior notice. Nothing in this Order limits the Commission's lawful use of compulsory process, pursuant to Sections 9 and 20 of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 49, 57b-1.

provisions.title: Order Effective Dates
provisions.summary: This Order becomes final and effective upon publication on the FTC website and will terminate 20 years from issuance, subject to extension if a complaint is filed alleging violations.

requirements.description: Order becomes final and effective upon publication on FTC website
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that this Order is final and effective upon the date of its publication on the Commission's website (ftc.gov) as a final order.

duration.termination_text: This Order will terminate 20 years from the date of its issuance (which date may be stated at the end of this Order, near the Commission's seal), or 20 years from the most recent date that the United States or the Commission files a complaint (with or without an accompanying settlement) in federal court alleging any violation of this Order, whichever comes later; provided, however, that the filing of such a complaint will not affect the duration of: A. Any Provision in this Order that terminates in less than 20 years; B. This Order's application to any Respondent that is not named as a defendant in such complaint; and C. This Order if such complaint is filed after the Order has terminated pursuant to this Provision. Provided, further, that if such complaint is dismissed or a federal court rules that the Respondent did not violate any provision of the Order, and the dismissal or ruling is either not appealed or upheld on appeal, then the Order will terminate according to this Provision as though the complaint had never been filed, except that the Order will not terminate between the date such complaint is filed and the later of the deadline for appealing such dismissal or ruling and the date such dismissal or ruling is upheld on appeal.
